questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. You can change the SDM template to maximize the number of supported MAC addresses. You noticed that the switch routing performance has been significantly degraded. Which action do you take to correct the problem?
//IMG//

comments.content:
'A' is wrong. If you disable routing then routing performance will become even worse.

'D' should be the correct answer as the switch needs resources for switching and routing.

discussion.content:
Answer A: VLAN

Routing—The routing template maximizes system resources for unicast routing, typically required for a router or aggregator in the center of a network.
VLANs—The VLAN template disables routing and supports the maximum number of unicast MAC addresses. It would typically be selected for a Layer 2 switch.
Default—The default template gives balance to all functions.
Access—The access template maximizes system resources for access control lists (ACLs) to accommodate a large number of ACLs.
